The unertainties in the γγ ross setions assoiated with FNP(Q,b) In the region Qr ~ Q, collinear QCD factorization at a finite fixed order in a, is ap- plicable. In order to include non-singular contributions important in this region, we add to W(Q, Qr, y, Q.) the regular piece Y (Q, Qr, y, Q.), defined as the difference between the NLO cross section P(Q, Qr,y,Q.) and its small-Qr asymptotic approximation A(Q, Qr, y, Q.): At small Qr, subtraction of A(Q, Qr,y,Q.) in Eq. (£9) cancels large initial-state radia- tive corrections in P(Q,Qr,y,Q.), which are incorporated in their resummed form within W(Q, Qr,y,Q2.). At Qr comparable to Q, A(Q,Qr,y,Q.) cancels the leading terms in W(Q, Qr,y,Q.), but higher-order contributions remain from the infinite tower of logarith- mic terms that are resummed in W. In this situation the W + Y cross section drops below the finite-order result P(Q, Qr, y,Q.) at some value of Qr (referred to as the crossing point) in both the gq+qg and gg+ gqs channels, for each Q and y.
